New issue

Need a name for our MVP #28

Open
iteles opened this Issue Feb 15, 2015 · 12 comments

Labels

discuss external dependency help wanted investigate MVP

Milestone

  MVP

Assignee

No one assigned

3 participants

Owner
iteles commented Feb 15, 2015

We need to find a good alpha name for our MVP. It doesn't need to be the final name and it doesn't need to be a stroke of genius, but we need something that we can refer to other than 'the time app'.

We considered something super simple and just descriptive but really, the app is more than just a timer - it's more of a time tracker - and it would be much better to have something that:

  • Has some personality
  • 1 or 2 syllables
  • Simple
  • Domain names are available (especially .com, .io or something equally 'standard')

Any thoughts?

Collaborator
FilWisher commented Feb 15, 2015

momentum

EDIT: Scratch that, you can't buy the domain anywhere

Owner
iteles commented Feb 15, 2015

@FilWisher But I like your thinking!

Owner
nelsonic commented Feb 16, 2015

@FilWisher momentum is sweet! really wish we could get the domain...
(also there are a few results for it in the app store...)

Coming up with a name (that is available) is hard...

nelsonic added help wanted discuss MVP investigate labels Feb 18, 2015
iteles referenced this issue Mar 11, 2015
Closed

Naming Conventions - What to call the People who Use the App? #33

iteles modified the milestone: MVP Apr 9, 2015
Owner
iteles commented Apr 24, 2015

Think we may have solved this one with a temporary name for now? @nelsonic?

Owner
nelsonic commented Apr 25, 2015

Maybe...
YOU solved it a year ago and didn't realise it till a few weeks back...!
Fingers crossed for the Trademark Application...

Owner
nelsonic commented May 16, 2015

backup name: adwyl (always do what you love)
I know it adds an unnecessary character.
but its still pretty short and means we get to the top of many alphabetical lists.
e.g: http://hapijs.com/community

Granted, it could be perceived as an advertising company...
@iteles thoughts?

Owner
iteles commented May 16, 2015

I feel like this is very much a backup and I'd have to warm to it (not an impossible task).

Agree that it will probably read as 'ad-wil' and remind people of advertising - which has pretty rubbishy connotations - and it also doesn't roll off the tongue so I feel like the usage as a verb might be lost. I'm also not a fan of it aesthetically but I suppose that's in comparison to 'dwyl' itself.

Granted, the alphabetical listing is pretty sweet. I think it's a good candidate for a backup.

@nelsonic Reckon we can close this issue and update it with the trademark stuff later?

Owner
nelsonic commented May 16, 2015

why close it?

Owner
iteles commented May 16, 2015

We should decide how we 'run' our issues. We could just add an 'on ice' or 'awaiting response' label so we know which of the many open issues doesn't require our attention for example?

Owner
nelsonic commented May 16, 2015

yeah, I'm on board with creating a label for things we are waiting for... please do it.

iteles added the on-ice label May 16, 2015
Owner
nelsonic commented May 16, 2015

@iteles I would prefer to apply something more descriptive like pending-external-dependency and then specify exactly what that dependency is in the issue when the label gets applied.

Owner
nelsonic commented Aug 2, 2015

@iteles do we have written confirmation of the trademark approval yet?
